ygData.subject: Re: Price Fixing
ygData.msgSnippet: This post was much better, the tone was even, you didn t rant a whole bunch, and it didn t make me think, Man this guys a Complete Looser, when I read it. I
ygData.messageBody:
This post was much better, the tone was even, you didn't rant a whole bunch,
and it didn't make me think, Man this guys a Complete Looser, when I read
it.

I don't have a short attention span, hell I spent 8-10 hours a day on this
game (and that is after work). But instead of going off on how things will
be, based on the RL market and all that I just move on.

That is the great power of this game... If one thing is unsatifying you move
on to the next. You can kill monsters alone, kill them in groups, if you
picked the right server you can kill players alone, or kill them in groups,
you can work on trade skills, explore your zone and on the ones around it,
talk to the NPC around and do some quests. And then just when you think you
have done it all--Move to a different geographical area! Then you get to
start over, cuz the mosters are different, and so are the players! Who has
time to sit around and be a merchant? there is adventure to be had in
Norrath!

-=Shazar=-

-----Original Message-----
From: David Rogers [mailto:derogers334@...]
Sent: Friday, May 21, 1999 6:57 AM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Price Fixing


From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>

--- Jason Coan <COANJ@...> wrote:
>> heh, I didn't even finish reading it myself...., but
>> I think I'm going to drop my prices further just to
>> piss this guy off even more

> I didn't even make it through half of this message,
> but man can't you find something better to put all
> that energy into?

Short attention span theater, two tickets reserved for the above quoted
individuals.

(shrug) I enjoy this game a lot, and that means I (gasp, here's the
kicker boys) think about it. Thoughts are more than single sentence
statements.

But go ahead and flame, you will anyway. We'll see who's right in
another month or two; I predict that servers with uber smiths charging
low prices will see only a few smiths left after a few weeks. If you
want the validating evidence as to this position, read that post you
lost interest in and wandering off to watch WWF in the middle of.

It's really a shame, I was looking forward to playing a smith too; but
why should I bother if I'll only make a gold over costs? I continue,
however, to hold out hope that Verdant will fix the trade skills, and
make them work as they should (platemail, weaponsmithing, cloth armor,
etc...)

===
:D
Dave's World
-No matter where you go, there you are-
"People will believe a lie either because they want to
believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
First Rule, Sword of Truth, Terry Goodkind
